# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is how you can define the function `add_yearmonth`:

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[ :ym ] = map((dt)->Dates.formatmmss(dt, "yyyyMM"), df[:dt])
end
```
This function creates a new column `:ym` in the DataFrame that stores the year and month from each DateTime in `:dt`. It uses the `map` function to apply the `Dates.formatmmss` function to every element of `:dt`, where `"yyyyMM"` is the format string that specifies how we want the date to be displayed.
